newsitem.title: UK: Lehman overweights India domestic cyclicals.
newsitem.headline: Lehman overweights India domestic cyclicals.

text.p: Lehman Brothers is overweighting the Indian stockmarket and has a target for the Bombay Stock Exchange Sensex index of 3,900 on a 12 month view.

"Given our forecast for a strong economic recovery and continued forecast declines in interest rates, we recommend moving away from stables (stocks) and selectively towards cyclicals," said senior strategist Abhijit Chakrabortti.
He recommends overweighting cement and construction and is adding to Gujarat Ambuja Cements Ltd, Larsen & Toubro Ltd and Indian Hotels, while cutting Hindustan Lever Ltd and MTNL.
Lehman has increased domestic cyclicals to 39 percent of its model portfolio from 35 percent and cut defensive stocks tro 22 percent from 28 percent.

Lehman said it remained sceptical about price performance in sectors vulnerable to global commodity cycles and does not recommend exposure to steel, petrochemicals or textiles, with the exception of Hindalco Ltd.
The BSE Sensex closed at a provisional 3,453.61 on Thursday.
